title: What Biden forgot in his Holocaust Memorial speech
message:
Opinion editor's note: Star Tribune Opinion publishes a mix of national and local commentaries online and in print each day.
Holocaust Memorial's Annual Days of Remembrance Ceremony, President Joe Biden compared what happened in Israel on Oct. 7 to that broad event of the 20th century.
'Never again,' simply translated for me," said Biden, speaking at the U.S. Capitol's Emancipation Hall, "means: 'Never forget.'
The Holocaust industry made the Holocaust all about the Jews and Hitler, and not a human tragedy.
In his book "The Holocaust Industry: Reflections on the Exploitation of Jewish Suffering," Norman Finkelstein argues that the American Jewish establishment exploits the memory of the Nazi Holocaust for political and financial gain and to further Israeli interests.

title: Berkeley Special Brand of  Anti - Zionism  Has Spread to Middle Schools
message:
Our local Jewish community is both horrified and petrified.
Some Jewish students, and their self-described Zionist parents, felt frightened by what they saw and heard, including a vulgar shout about Zionism — a claim vigorously denied by demonstrators.
In Berkeley, even the Middle School kids, ages 10-14, are holding walkouts for Gaza.
The Friday walkout included more than 100 students, ages 11 to 14, from the district’s three middle schools, with marches to UC Berkeley’s Sproul Plaza to join Gaza protesters at their pro-Palestinian encampment.
Middle School kids aren't supposed to leave school during the day.

title: College professor to stand trial in death of pro - Israel counter - protester last year
message:
How one college says it ended campus Gaza protests with dialogueHow one college ended campus protests with talksHow one college ended campus protests with talksVentura, Calif. — A judge decided Wednesday that a Southern California college professor will stand trial for involuntary manslaughter and battery in the death of a Jewish counter-protester during demonstrations over the Israel-Hamas war last year.
Alnaji was charged with two felonies: involuntary manslaughter and battery causing serious bodily injury, with special allegations of personally inflicting great bodily harm injury on each count, the DA's office said.

While antisemitic hate speech was heard at the November 5, 2023, rally, there is no evidence those words were said by Alnaji."

title: Why the world stopped laughing at  tone - deaf rich guy  Jerry Seinfeld
message:
The cause of the protests was Seinfeld’s support for Israel in its war against Hamas.
Hence the rather less than welcoming response at Duke, where, ironically, two of Seinfeld’s own children studied.
But the comedian has not exactly been winning fans in recent months, ever since he began his publicity campaign for his new Netflix comedy, Unfrosted.
The film, which explores the creation of Kellogg’s Pop-Tarts in the Sixties, not only starred Seinfeld, but was directed, co-written and co-produced by him as well.
As Richard Roeper put it in the Chicago Sun-Times: “Unfrosted is one of the worst films of the decade so far.”

title: Harvard University Deceived Public in Response to Antisemitism , Shocking Congressional Report Alleges
message:

title: Campus Gaza protests :  Safetyism  has made colleges less safe
message:
